section.title: Memory Down Decoupling Config: X16 SDP
section.p: Description: This is PI guidance for the DDR5 x16 SDP memory down solution if the customers choose to merge VDD/ VDDQ rails on the platform.

The capacitor quantity if for 8 DRAM devices. Each DDR channel to have two X16 DRAM devices. The layout example shows the decoupling cap placement for 4 DRAM devices. The same strategy can be extended to all the 8 X16 DRAM devices. Customers should check the DRAM supplier datasheets for the VDD/ VDDQ voltage levels and only merge if they are the same voltage.

entry.p: Information provided here is only for guidance. Customers are responsible for meeting all JEDEC SPECS on the Memory power rails
VDD/VDDQ (VDD & VDDQ rails are merged on the platform)
4 caps per DRAM, as close as possible to VDD/ VDDQ BGAs.
Customers may adjust the capacitor quantity/ form factor/ value to meet the JEDEC spec.
DDR5 Memory Down X16
VDD/ VDDQ (VDD & VDDQ rails are merged on the platform)
1 cap per DRAM, as close as possible to VDD/ VDDQ BGAs.
Customers may adjust the capacitor quantity/ form factor/ value to meet the JEDEC spec.
DDR5 Memory Down X16
VPP
2 caps per DRAM. One per short side connecting the VPP BGAs.
Customers may adjust the capacitor quantity/ form factor/ value to meet the JEDEC spec.
DDR5 Memory Down X16
VPP
1 cap per DRAM, close as possible to VPP BGAs.
Customers may adjust the capacitor quantity/ form factor/ value to meet the JEDEC spec.

section.title: Small Outline Dual In-line Memory Module (SODIMM)
section.p: DDR5 SODIMM comes with PMIC/ VR and decoupling on the module card itself, hence no additional decoupling guidelines are required. Nevertheless the source supply to the DDR5 SODIMM needs to follow the JEDEC/ vendor specification sheet.
